Culinary Profile & Uses
1. Flavour and Form

‘Frond-Flash’ offers the classic, clean dill profile: a bright, grassy flavour with distinct notes of anise, lemon, and a subtle celery-like freshness. Its foliage is finely dissected, feathery, and a vibrant light green, growing on a sturdy, self-supporting plant that remains productive for weeks longer than common dill.

2. The Bright, Fresh Finisher

This dill is the quintessential herb for adding a fresh, lively note to a wide array of dishes, particularly those from Northern and Eastern European cuisines.

  • The Seafood Partner: The indispensable garnish for gravlax (cured salmon) and a key flavour in creamy sauces for poached fish, shrimp, and scallops.
  • Salads & Dips: A vital component in potato salads, cucumber salads, tzatziki, and sour cream-based dips, where its bright flavour cuts through richness.
  • Pickling & Preserving: While bred for leaf production, if allowed to eventually flower, its umbels are perfect for flavourful pickling of cucumbers, beans, and other vegetables.
3. The Harvest and Yield

The plant is a fast-growing annual with a strong, central focus on foliage. Harvest the outer, feathery fronds regularly, allowing the central growing point to continue producing new leaves. Supplied as an RFID seed pad, it provides a rapid and continuous yield of 20–40g of delicate fronds per week for an extended season before it finally decides to bolt.
